name: quickwit
description: Quickwit is a cloud-native search engine for large-scale log storage and querying. It offers web-based query UI, REST APIs, and is optimized for low storage costs and fast indexing.
features: Cloud-native architecture: Designed for object storage like S3 to minimize infrastructure costs and maximize scalability.
Fast indexing: Ingest millions of logs per second with distributed indexing across multiple nodes.
Full-text search: Query logs using Elasticsearch-compatible syntax for familiar search operations.
Web query UI: Execute searches and visualize results through an intuitive browser-based interface.
REST API: Integrate log search into applications and dashboards using standard HTTP endpoints.
Cost-optimized storage: Store petabytes of logs at a fraction of traditional search engine costs.
Time-based partitioning: Automatically organize data by time ranges for efficient querying and retention management.
Distributed architecture: Scale horizontally by adding nodes to handle increased log volume and query load.
Schema flexibility: Define custom fields and data types to match your log structure and search requirements.
Retention policies: Configure automatic deletion of old data to comply with regulations and manage storage costs.
Aggregation queries: Analyze log patterns with grouping, counting, and statistical operations.
OpenTelemetry support: Ingest traces and logs from modern observability tools using standard protocols.
